snippet.title: Metal Dungeon Playthrough
snippet.description:
If you'd just like to listen to the area recordings, you can find a video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U4uFOsWA7LQ
If you'd just like to see the two pre-rendered cutscenes this game has, you can find a video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XbowIPMDdVs

Luck is a skill. 
As far as I can tell, no one has bothered to upload a full playthrough of this game to youtube.
I only made a few edits. I cut out some nonsense in area 2 and the imp stone hunt/grind in area 6. The raw recording is 11 hours and 41 minutes long.

Developed by Panther Software and published by Xicat Interactive in 2002, Metal Dungeon is a dungeon crawler only released on the Xbox. This is a complete playthrough of areas 1-10. I am not madman enough to do areas 11-100.

This game is running on an original Xbox. I am using a scalar converter to stretch the video to 1920x1080.

00:00 - Intro
03:44 - Game Start
11:23 - Area 1 Recording
1:39:08 - Area 1 Boss
1:54:00 - Area 2 Recording
2:26:36 - Area 2 Boss
2:35:35 - Area 3 Recording
3:05:07 - Area 3 Boss
3:09:44 - Area 4 Recording
3:54:37 - Area 4 Boss
4:00:30 - Area 5 Recording
5:22:28 - Area 5 Boss
5:27:34 - Area 6 Recording
5:44:56 - Area 6 Boss
5:51:05 - Area 7 Recording
6:14:31 - Area 7 Boss
6:24:20 - Area 8 Recording
7:10:22 - Area 8 Boss
7:18:12 - Area 9 Recording
8:42:09 - Area 9 Boss
8:50:28 - Area 10 Recording
9:25:57 - Area 10 Final Boss
9:37:53 - End Cutscene
9:40:12 - Credits




I think this is a okay dungeon crawler. I may have some masochistic tendencies, though.

The biggest issues for me are the lack of a turn order indicator and not having descriptions for spells/items during battle. I also found it to be a little on the easier side, since you get access to party wide healing pretty early on and status effects can mostly be ignored (except for paralyze in area 5, but you can just muscle through those fights anyway)
